result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL C PLOSS

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.   No resolution, set a plea/sent date 30 - 45 days out.  Bond Continues. Victim addresses the court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety. No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing. No alcohol consumption or possession. No in person contact with V1 or their residence in OPD report 22-28109.Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact. Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.

10:35 AM Defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS in court.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for MICHAEL C PLOSS.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin.  NG plea entered, set for plea/sent.  The Victim addresses the court, requests to lift the no contact. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State objects.  Defense requests to lift the no contact.  The Court will amend to no in person contact with V1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety. No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing. No alcohol consumption or possession. No contact with V1 or their residence in OPD report 22-28109.Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact. Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells & Atty Thao  appeared by video for MICHAEL C PLOSS. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. Advised of rights. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Victim addresses the court. Record closed @ 340
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
